rationales.11: Anwar was deemed morally unfit for office and was subsequently detained as a national security risk.

rationales.2: Anwar was subsequently arrested on September 20 and accused of engaging in homosexual acts, which are illegal under Malaysian law. However, these charges are widely seen as a pretext for his political persecution.

rationales.5: In 17 years as prime minister, Mahathir, 72, who is a medical doctor, fostered an economic liberalization that led to some of the world's fastest rates of growth. He drove Malaysians to be more productive, to embrace high technology and to begin major investments around the world.

rationales.14: Anwar was dismissed by Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad on September 2 due to disagreements on economic policy, and he began speaking out against Mahathir before being arrested on September 20.
